item.title: 'Fifty Shades of Grey' tops Razzie Awards
item.description: "Fifty Shades of Grey" dominated the winners list at this year's Razzies with five total nods, including worst actor, worst actress, worst screenplay, worst screen combo and the big winner of the night, worst picture. The 36th annual satirical awards show, honoring "Fifty Shades" as last year's "Most Successful Bad Movie," was held on Feb. 27, the night before the Oscars.
item.ExtractedText:
Facebook Twitter Instagram
'Fifty Shades of Grey' tops Razzie Awards By Abid Rahman, The Hollywood Reporter Updated 2231 GMT (0631 HKT) February 28, 2016 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "50 Shades of Grey" won five Razzie Awards this year, tying for Worst Picture. Here are some of the other terrible pictures to make the Razzies' list: Hide Caption 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films The reboot of "Fantastic Four" tied for Worst Picture. Hide Caption 2 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Movie 43" took worst picture of the year in 2014. The film, a compilation of lowbrow shorts, didn't do well at the box office, either. Hide Caption 3 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Fans may have thought it had teeth, but "The Twilight Saga: Breaking Dawn Part 2" took worst picture at the ceremony in 2013. And it didn't stop there: The film actually scores a total of seven Razzies, including worst actress for Kristen Stewart, worst supporting actor for Taylor Lautner and worst director for Bill Condon. Hide Caption 4 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "The Last AIrbender" is also in last place on many moviegoers' favorite films list. It won worst picture in 2011. Hide Caption 5 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen" can't even be saved by hottie Megan Fox (not pictured). It won in 2010. Hide Caption 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Poor Mike Myers. The Razzies showed no love for "The Love Guru" in 2009. Hide Caption 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Beginning of the end for Lindsay Lohan? "I Know Who Killed Me" won in 2008. Hide Caption 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Basic Instinct 2" didn't thrill Razzie voters in 2007. Hide Caption 9 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Dirty Love" cleaned up at the Razzies in 2006, including worst picture and a worst actress win for star Jenny McCarthy. Hide Caption 10 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Halle Berry becomes the first person to go from winning an Oscar (for "Monster's Ball") to winning a Razzie for "Catwoman," which took worst picture in 2005. Hide Caption 11 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films One word for you: "Gigli." The height of Bennifer as well as the 2004 Razzie winner. Hide Caption 12 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Madonna takes direction from her then-husband Guy Ritchie in "Swept Away," and it swept five Razzies, including worst picture, in 2003. Hide Caption 13 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Freddy Got Fingered" wins Tom Green both a worst actor and worst director Razzie in 2002. Hide Caption 14 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films John Travolta believed wholeheartedly in "Battlefield Earth" in 2001. He was the only one. It swept he Razzies with a total of nine wins. Hide Caption 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Wild Wild West" won in 2000 and gave gigantic, mechanical spiders a bad name. Hide Caption 16 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "An Alan Smithee Film: Burn Hollywood Burn" is a comedy that funnily enough won in 1999. Hide Caption 17 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films How can a movie featuring Demi Moore taking it off be bad? Let us count the ways. "Striptease" won the Razzie in 1997. Hide Caption 18 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Can a bomb become a classic? It seems like "Showgirls" can do anything, including win the 1996 Razzie for worst picture. Hide Caption 19 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Bruce Willis (seen here with Jane March) makes his second appearance on the list when "Color of Night" won in 1995. Hide Caption 20 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Robert Redford and Demi Moore may like to forget "Indecent Proposal," winner of the Razzie in 1994. Hide Caption 21 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Shining Through" ... doesn't. The Michael Douglas and Melanie Griffith war drama took worst pic in 1993. Hide Caption 22 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Hudson Hawk" didn't do any favors for Bruce Willis' career. The film flew away with worst picture in 1992. Hide Caption 23 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Andrew "Dice" Clay rolls them on this one and comes up snake eyes. "The Adventures of Ford Fairlane" won a few Razzies, including worst picture (which it shared in 1991 with Bo Derek's "Ghosts Can't Do It") and worst actor for Clay. Hide Caption 24 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films This one hurts even the trekkies. "Star Trek V: The Final Frontier" is considered both a commercial and critical failure to many, and the Razzies took note. It won worst pic in 1990. Hide Caption 25 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Cocktail" seems to have so much going for it, including a young Tom Cruise. Whatever. It still was awarded the worst picture Razzie in 1989. Hide Caption 26 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films The great Bill Cosby is not often associated with failure, but "Leonard Part 6" fell short and became winner of the Razzie in 1988. Hide Caption 27 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Howard the Duck" has become synonymous with a clunker at the box office. Hence its worst picture win in 1987 where it tied with.... Hide Caption 28 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Under the Cherry Moon." We defy you to explain exactly what this film is about. Great soundtrack by the movie's star Prince, but the rest? Not so much. It tied for worst picture with "Howard the Duck" in 1987. Hide Caption 29 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "Rambo: First Blood Part II" kills it - but not in a good way. It took the worst picture Razzie in 1986. Hide Caption 30 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films Bo Derek steams up the screen in "Bolero," but said heat doesn't keep it from winning six Razzies, including worst picture, actress and director in 1985. Hide Caption 31 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films "The Lonely Lady" is a movie about Hollywood. And Hollywood seemed to hate it. It won a Razzie for worst picture in 1984. Hide Caption 32 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films A film starring the legendary Laurence Olivier and Jacqueline Bisset couldn't go wrong, right? Think again. "Inchon" took the top prize for worst picture in 1983. Hide Caption 33 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films It's a camp classic now, but "Mommie Dearest" starring Faye Dunaway was the worst of the worst in 1982. Hide Caption 34 of 35 35 photos: The Razzies: Best of the worst films The distinction of the first Golden Raspberry Award a.k.a. Razzie in 1981 went to "Can't Stop the Music," which was a fake biopic of The Village People. Hide Caption
